result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:34 AM Defendant Marion D Mcelroy in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.    
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:00 PM Defendant Marion D Mcelroy appeared by Zoom with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.
The Court notes that the Defendant is doing well on WCS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on July 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022. (BC)

01:44 PM Defendant Marion D Mcelroy in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant sworn and testified regarding not possessing a passport and not applying for a passport.  Defendant needs more time to obtain counsel.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court grants more time to obtain counsel.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marion D Mcelroy
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha Co Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2022)
Prior: 4455 N 89Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Proposed Protective Order
The original document name was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 06-10-2022
Hearing on June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment (with the exception the defendant is allowed to go to work at Walmart in Germantown), school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

02:56 PM Defendant Marion D Mcelroy in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
